choices: White blood cells are responsible for fighting pathogens inside the body. Pathogens can enter bodies and cause them to become sick. However, white blood cells are not always effective.
There are two major types of immune that organisms have: innate and adaptive. The skin and mucus are part of the adaptive immune system.

The way that the immune system works is remarkably complex. Skin, the first line of defense, can keep foreign objects out of the body, while white blood cells, acting like soldiers fighting invaders, can fight pathogens in the body.

The skin, the body’s first line of defense, helps animals fight off diseases. Also, the mucus in the nose prevents airborne foreign bodiesâmany of which do very little goodâfrom entering the body.
